creator.name: National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"41alh","text":"Genetically-encoded oxidase, LaccID, oxidizes and precipitates DAB with oxygen and therefore without the need for H2O2 or light.  LaccID-expressing HEX293T cells precipitated DAB and were processed for TEM. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Oxidation,DAB precipitation,Laccase, dab precipitation by laccase oxidation, laccase oxidation, precipitates dab with oxygen, precipitates dab, encoded oxidase, dab precipitation, laccid, dab, oxidation, need for h2o2, h2o2, oxygen

materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"838r3","text":"1.  MatTek dishes containing 35mm glass bottom No. 0 coverslips coated with poly-d-lysine (P35GC-0-14C,    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4nc0","text":"     MatTek Corporation)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17kc9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gq1v","text":"2. 0.1M sodium cacodylate with 2 mM CaCl2, pH 7.4 (12310, Electron Microscopy Sciences)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":40,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b7ub","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jc1s","text":"3. 2% glutaraldehyde (18426, Ted Pella Incorporated)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ets2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lk61","text":"4. 3,3’- Diaminobenzidine (DAB) (D8001-10G, Sigma-Aldrich)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30ql9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42l6r","text":"5. 1% osmium tetroxide (EMS, 19150)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsk7f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43puk","text":"6. Ethanol series","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ogte","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5evno","text":"7. Durcupan ACM resin (Sigma-Aldrich, 44610)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eumfn","text":"LaccID-expressing HEX293T cells are plated onto MatTek dishes containing 35mm glass bottom No. 0 coverslips coated with poly-d-lysine (P35GC-0-14C, MatTek Corporation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"apsk5","text":"Cells are washed five times for 2 min each on ice with cold 0.1M sodium cacodylate with 2 mM CaCl2, pH 7.4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":97,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"u03f","text":"Cell are blocked for 5 min with cold 20 mM glycine in 0.1M sodium cacodylate with 2 mM CaCl2, pH 7.4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":91,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"676oc","text":"A freshly solution of 5.4 mg of 3,3’- Diaminobenzidine (DAB) (D8001-10G, Sigma-Aldrich) is dissolved in 1.0 ml of 0.1 N HCl and added to 9.0 ml 0.1M sodium cacodylate buffer with 2 mM CaCl2, pH 7.4 buffer.     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":188,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duk98","text":"Cells are then washed five times for 2 min each with cold 0.1M sodium cacodylate with 2 mM CaCl2, pH 7.4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":95,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ee7c","text":"Cells are post-fixed with 1% osmium tetroxide (EMS, 19150) in 0.1 M sodium cacodylate buffer pH 7.4 for 30 min on ice. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3g8q0","text":"Postfixative is removed and cells are washed (five times for 1 min each) with 0.1 M sodium cacodylate buffer pH 7.4 containing 2 mM CaCl2 on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":136,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bo7tf","text":"Cells are washed (five times for 1 min each) with cold double-distilled H2O (ddH2O) on ice.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":73,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":80,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kb1j","text":"Cells are dehydrated with an ethanol series (20%, 50%, 70%, 90% and 100%) on ice for 1 min each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b0hjd","text":"Cells are dehydrated with 100% dry ethanol at room temperature three times for 1 min each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm1qd","text":"Cells are infiltrated with 50:50 dry ethanol:Durcupan ACM resin (Sigma-Aldrich, 44610) for 30 min and then four changes of Durcupan at 1 h each and finally embedded in a vacuum oven at 60 °C for 72 hours.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5eadf","text":"Cells are fixed using warm 2% glutaraldehyde (18426, Ted Pella Incorporated) in buffer 0.1M sodium cacodylate with 2 mM CaCl2, pH 7.4 (12310, Electron Microscopy Sciences) and then quickly moved to ice for 55 minutes.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":124,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdlve","text":"The DAB solution is added to cells for at least 3-30 min at room temperature until the desired brown intensity color of the precipitate was visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: DAB precipitation by Laccase Oxidation

creator.name: National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research
